thread.title: New York Red Bulls win, take solo lead in Major League Soccer’s Eastern Conference
thread.title_full: New York Red Bulls win, take solo lead in Major League Soccer’s Eastern Conference | The Seattle Times

author: Seattle Times staff
title: New York Red Bulls win, take solo lead in Major League Soccer’s Eastern Conference
text:
HARRISON, N.J. – Bradley Wright-Phillips scored the go-ahead goal in the first half and the New York Red Bulls held on to beat the Columbus Crew 2-1 in Major League Soccer on Saturday night.
The playoff-bound Red Bulls (15-9-6) have a three-point lead over second-place D.C. United in the Eastern Conference. New York has 51 points from 30 matches; D.C. has played 32 matches.
Goalkeeper Steve Clark of the Crew (13-11-8) tried to kick the ball to Harrison Afful, but it was intercepted by a charging Connor Lade. Lade crossed the ball to Wright-Phillips, who scored off a header in the 21st minute for his 15th goal of the season.
The Crew’s Justin Meram split several defenders, and floated his shot just off New York player Damien Perrinelle’s head and through goalkeeper Luis Robles’ hands in the ninth minute.
  Lloyd Sam of the Red Bulls tied the score three minutes later. Sacha Kljestan assisted on the goal.
Toronto triumphs TORONTO – Sebastian Giovinco and Jozy Altidore scored and Toronto FC also took advantage of an own goal to beat the Philadelphia Union 3-1 to close in on the first playoff berth in franchise history.
Toronto improved to 14-13-4. Philadelphia (9-16-7) was eliminated from playoff contention.
Giovinco, on his third free kick of the first half, converted in the 28th minute from the edge of the penalty area when his shot deflected off Raymon Gaddis in the wall and looped high into the far corner of the goal. Giovinco has 21 goals this season.
Altidore scored in the 63rd, his 12th goal of the season.
Seattle Times staff
